result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $600.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges to be paid during term of probation or civil judgment.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs during term of probation or civil judgment. 
If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court orders previously forfeited bail in the amount of $2,500.00 to be reinstated and transferred to 14CM4138 to be applied to restitution.
Seek/maintain full time employment or attend school.

No contact with weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause. 
No use or possession of illegal drugs or alcohol.
No driving.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: With 14 days credit, with Huber for work and treatment.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 years, consecutive to 14CM4138; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 30 months.

Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $600.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges to be paid during term of probation or civil judgment.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 3 years.
Court ordered ignition interlock for a period of 3 years, consecutive to revocation.
  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, with 14 days credit, with huber for work and treatment.
- No further violations of the law that rise to probable cause. 
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  
- No use or possession of illegal drugs or alcohol.
- Random urine screens.  No positive results.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
- Seek/maintain full time employment or attend school.  
- No contact with weapons.
- No driving. 
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment. 
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs during term of probation or civil judgment. 

If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court orders previously forfeited bail in the amount of $2,500.00 to be reinstated and transferred to 14CM4138 to be applied to restitution. 

Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Driver Assessment and Safety Plan, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
WCS discharge report, received and filed

Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  As to Count 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed and read in the count.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS report, received and filed
Court order the defenant turned over to WCS. Court ordered breathalyzer testing, SCRAM, absolute sobriety, and no driving without a valid license.

All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Donald Tyrone Preyar in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
